content:
I share the same sentiment, and it is a concern that has been raised by many people. the algorithm used by social media platforms can indeed prioritize sensational and emotional stories over factual ones, leading to the spread of fake news and misinformation. however, there are some ways to try to change that.

firstly, users can choose to engage with and share factual news sources while avoiding sensational and misleading stories. this can help to send signals to social media algorithms, showing that accurate news stories receive more engagement and should get priority.

secondly, social media platforms can take a more proactive approach by improving their algorithms to prioritize factual and credible news sources over sensational stories. additionally, they could invest more heavily in fact-checking, moderation, transparency, and verification.

ultimately, creating a culture that values and promotes accurate news, critical thinking, and informed debate can help to reduce the spread of fake news and misinformation on social media.
